Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and much of the interior has flaked away, the exterior is very worn and only very faint traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394330) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394330)
